svg.text: Investigating the Role of Ras Signaling

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 9px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4; color: #333;

foreignObject.div: This study investigated the role of Ras signaling in Drosophila melanogaster eye development using genetic crosses and microscopy techniques. We demonstrated that constitutively active Ras leads to overgrowth and disruption of ommatidial patterning in the developing eye.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 9px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4; color: #333;

foreignObject.div: The Ras signaling pathway plays a crucial role in regulating cell proliferation, differentiation, and survival across species. In Drosophila melanogaster, this pathway is essential for proper eye development, making it an excellent model system for studying Ras function.

svg.text: Figure 1: Comparison of wild-type and Ras mutant Drosophila eyes
